body: FYI, @alexeagle .  I don't know if this should be fixed in rules_js or in Bazel (or in both, the error message is pretty unhelpful).
Could you check whether `--noincompatible_sandbox_hermetic_tmp` fixes this?

> noincompatible_sandbox_hermetic_tmp

Unfortunately, no.

```
$ bazel test -c opt //... --noincompatible_sandbox_hermetic_tmp
INFO: Invocation ID: c3732082-ecf0-4c68-b7e6-b398ae21fd07
INFO: Analyzed 5080 targets (0 packages loaded, 0 targets configured).
ERROR: /home/austin/local/971-Robot-Code/BUILD:8:22: Extracting npm package pngjs@5.0.0 failed: I/O exception during sandboxed execution: Could not move output artifacts from sandboxed execution
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.
```
@AustinSchuh Were you able to find a workaround for this ? I'm encountering the same
I applied the following diff to `rules_js`: https://github.com/frc971/971-Robot-Code/blob/master/third_party/rules_js/0001-Fix-package-permissions.patch

issue.title: [7.3.0] Could not move output artifacts from sandboxed execution

issue.title: [7.3.0] Fix permissions on tree artifact subdirectories as needed to move them out of the sandbox.

issue.body:
Similar to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/547f0c6955942e6aafd279adbb2f5368a7a2347e, but also includes the r and x bits.

Fixes #22260.
